content.description: Although this line may look intimidating with its 6-inch crack, you don't need to jam once. Chimney up the curved crack on solid granite to chains. The rope drag could be a little much for a toprope on this one, so it might be wise to belay your second up. This route could also be used to access some other cracks on the upper deck. The last portion of the approach features some heinous bushwacking and spikey raspberryÂ bushes.
content.protection: Pro from 3-7", Chains. 70m rope. It may be possible with a 60m, but it would be close.
content.location: Located on the Western side of the North Face. Look for the clean wide arching crack left of the cracks that make up the Parrot's Beak. The route ends before a cave in the roof above.
